titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

did.repository: University of Delaware Special Collections Department Morris Library, 181 South College Avenue Newark, DE 19717-5267

bioghist.p: George Adolphus Storey, R.A. (1834-1919), English portrait and genre painter, member of the "St. John's Wood Clique," was a professor of perspective and author of art books and poetry. He studied in Paris under the guidance of J.L. Dulong, and in London at the Royal Academy. His paintings were exhibited at Burlington House and at the Royal Academy.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of the papers of George Adolphus Storey. Materials include: sketchbooks, notebooks, diaries, travel records, inventories of paintings executed and sold, poems, fiction, essays, plays, lecture notes, school books, art criticism, writings on perspective, and an artist's recipe book. Several of the notebooks include original sketches and drawings.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
